item.title: Margie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Margie add a quote by John McPhee
item.description: "I used to sit in class and listen to the terms come floating down the room like paper airplanes." -- John McPhee

item.title: Margie add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Margie add a quote by Rodman Philbrick
item.description: "Books are like truth serum-- if you don't read, you can't figure out what's real." -- Rodman Philbrick

item.title: Margie add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Margie add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Margie add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Margie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Margie add a quote by Amy Sedaris
item.description: "I think it's good for a person to spend time alone. It gives them an opportunity to discover who they are and to figure out why they are always alone." -- Amy Sedaris

item.title: Margie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Margie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Margie add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Total non-retention has kept my education from being a burden to me." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Margie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Libraries really are wonderful. They're better than bookshops, even. I mean bookshops make a profit on selling you books, but libraries just sit there lending you books quietly out of the goodness of their hearts." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Margie add a quote by John McPhee
item.description: "If by some fiat I had to restrict all this writing to one sentence, this is the one I would choose: The summit of Mt. Everest is marine limestone. " -- John McPhee

item.title: Margie add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Margie add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Margie add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do. I feel as if this tree knows everything I ever think of when I sit here. When I come back to it, I never have to remind it of anything; I begin just where I left off." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Margie add a quote by Annie Proulx
item.description: "You know, one of the tragedies of real life is that there is no background music." -- Annie Proulx

item.title: Margie add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "If you've had good gin on a hot day in Southern California with the people you love, you forget Nebraska. The two things cannot coexist. The stronger, better of the two wins." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Margie add a quote by J.D. Robb
Margie add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Margie add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley
